definition: sweet given on a happy occasion (esp. wedding)
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
sugar/sweets/candy/CL:顆|颗[ke1],塊|块[kuai4]
old variant of 糖[tang2]

sentences.english: Wedding packages can be uesd as high-grade candy.
sentences.chinese: 让你的婚礼用喜糖更加高档专业时尚。

sentences.english: Current conditions and prospects of carton packaging of wedding candy were introduced.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了婚庆喜糖纸盒包装的市场现状及前景。

sentences.english: And said, that one day, you will let me eat your joyful candy.
sentences.chinese: 并说，到那么一天，你会让我吃你的喜糖。

definition: double happiness cakes, pastries offered by a man to his fiancée's family at the time of their engagement
wedding invitation
tip given on a happy occasion (traditional)
give birth to a son soon (propitiatory compliment to the newly-weds)
wedding feast/liquor drunk at a wedding feast
red-painted eggs, traditional celebratory gift on third day after birth of new baby
candy/CL:粒[li4]
gift money (on the occasion of a wedding etc)
to prepare a feast
money wrapped in red as a gift/bonus payment/kickback/bribe
gift given when visiting sb (esp. a local specialty brought back from one's travels, or a special product of one's own country taken overseas) (Tw)
bridegroom/groom
wedding reception
monetary gift
wedding ceremony/wedding/CL:場|场[chang3]
wedding celebration
